abstract: Fox claimed a share of first place in the ratings on Monday, thanks largely to the strength of its medical drama, “House,” about a cantankerous doctor.
snippet: Fox claimed a share of first place in the ratings on Monday, thanks largely to the strength of its medical drama, “House,” about a cantankerous doctor.
lead_paragraph: Fox claimed a share of first place in the ratings on Monday, thanks largely to the strength of its medical drama, “House,” about a cantankerous doctor. Despite a modest audience of 13.3 million viewers, according to Nielsen’s estimates, the 9 p.m. show delivered the night’s top ratings among adults 18 to 49, enough to lift Fox into a tie with CBS for first in that demographic even though Fox’s “Bones” earned relatively mediocre results at 8 p.m. (8.1 million).

headline.main: He’s No Marcus Welby, But Viewers Like Him Anyway
